info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 17 at 8:50AM CDT until September 18 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Goodland KS
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Nebraska...
Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson affecting Hitchcock County.
For the Frenchman Creek...including Culbertson...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Frenchman Creek near Culbertson.
* WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Lowland areas near the vicinity of the gage will become flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 4.2 feet Saturday evening. It will then rise to 4.3 feet Sunday morning. It will fall to 4.2 feet Sunday evening then rise again. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.0 feet on 08/11/2019.
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
